content.description: Start sitting near the tree. Pull on a good block / sidepull and follow the edge rail to the right until reaching a solid right hand sidepull rail. Slap and compress straight up with a couple crimps out left. As one fellow said this is full value.
content.protection: one or two boulder pads should be fine. the landing is perfectly flat and pretty much rock free.
content.location: This problem is on the west (creek side of the Stuff Shootin boulder). very easy to find as you see it from the creek as you approach.

content.description: Obvious Arete on the creek side of Stuff Shootin boulder. Solid stone, good movement, fun topout, and good landing. Enjoy!
content.location: Start sitting. Its the Arete to the right from the creek.

content.description: Difficult compression bouldering on a gorgeous bit of rock. Begin perched at a sloper and a right-facing rail. Climb straight up past flat sidepulls and a discouraging sloper. Maybe the best boulder in Sedona.
content.protection: Two pads will suffice, three or four would be ideal. Not horribly tall, but falling while topping out could be dangerous.
content.location: Hike downstream to the first bouldering area and cross Oak Creek. Stuff Shootin is on the backside of the large boulder directly across the creek.

content.description: Start down low to the left of the roots on a thin crack with the left hand and a palm to the right, or however else you want to start sitting. Move right towards Stuff Shootin with a large move under the bulge and then another to good crimps. Grab the left facing block with a bit of tenuous footing and enjoy the easy topout over the nice landing zone. A few more hands and some brushing will turn this climb into a real gem in its grade.
content.protection: The start stays relatively low and doesn't really need a pad, 1-2 pads protect the harder crimps and the topout.
content.location: Left of Stuff Shootin and right of the unknown Arete. You climb between the tree and the boulder. Shares a start with the obvious hand crack climb.

content.description: Start with good undercling and work up through gaston and undercling features to the large fin.
content.location: Cross the creek from the first area and find Suff Shootin', this climb is just to the right.

content.description: There are several boulders scattered around across the creek from the first bouldering area down canyon. Some of these blocks are huge.
